docs.lead_paragraph: 1:56 p.m. | Updated The Small Business Jobs Act of 2010 -- as detailed below -- passed the Senate on Thursday by a vote of 61 to 38. Two Republicans, Sen. George Voinovich of Ohio and Sen. George LeMieux of Florida voted with the Democratic majority.

headline.main: What the Latest Senate Small-Business Jobs Bill Offers

docs.abstract: Highlights from the bill's provisions, some of which are permanent and far-reaching.
docs.snippet: Highlights from the bill's provisions, some of which are permanent and far-reaching.

docs.lead_paragraph: Amy Julia Becker is expecting her third child in January. She is 32 years old, and her age, plus the fact that her first child was born with Down syndrome, magnifies her odds of a chromosomal abnormality in this pregnancy, leading her doctors to suggest prenatal testing. In spite of the odds - or perhaps because of them - and her husband have declined the tests. In a guest post today, she explains why.

headline.main: Deciding Not to Screen for Down Syndrome

docs.abstract: Why one couple, at greater risk than most, has decided to have fewer prenatal tests.
docs.snippet: Why one couple, at greater risk than most, has decided to have fewer prenatal tests.

docs.lead_paragraph: If the new health care legislation remains intact, it could offer real money for a lot of Americans. Or so says a Families USA report released on Tuesday that estimates that nearly 29 million people will be eligible for tax credits under the law if they are buying private health insurance beginning in 2014.

headline.main: Promoting the Health Care Law as a Tax Cut

docs.abstract: An advocacy group for the new health care legislation says new tax credits would be a boon to middle-income families.
docs.snippet: An advocacy group for the new health care legislation says new tax credits would be a boon to middle-income families.

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal advisory panels this week will vote on whether to remove the weight-loss drug Meridia from the market and whether to move nonprescription cough medicines behind drugstore counters. The Food and Drug Administration will also review genetically engineered salmon during a busy week of regulatory action.
docs.abstract: The F.D.A. this week reviews the abuse of cough medicines and the safety of a diet pill.
docs.snippet: The F.D.A. this week reviews the abuse of cough medicines and the safety of a diet pill.

docs.lead_paragraph: Democratic candidates are not extolling their party’s accomplishments, but rather distancing themselves from their party’s agenda.
